Articles.Content:
Have you ever wanted to take an orange fuel tank to orbit, but you didn't want to waste a perfectly good rocket? The answer is here! The new SPO-48 spaceplane is just what you need:

Full album: http://imgur.com/a/GKhcw#0

Download: http://www./?vy8vpuwakff0jrb

Please post all up to date designs to the Stock Repository! Thank you!
How do you prevent catastrophic flame-outs at altitude? I always manage to go into a flat spin with more than one engine.

This thing will not stay on the runway for me. Keeps pulling off to the right no matter what. Even when I manage to keep it from tipping and crashing, pitching the nose up drags the backend and crashes anyway.

The middle engine should (should) flameout first, giving you adequate warning of low air. I also have action groups established to shut down groups of the engines.

It also has sepatrons mounted on the front landing gear leg to give you that nose kick in the air you need to get off the ground.

Sorry for not explaining this, it was a quick reupload after the forum crash.

This thing is a beast, and YAY the forums are back!

EDIT: My reputation! NO! It's all gone! ;(

This thing is a beast, and YAY the forums are back!

EDIT: My reputation! NO! It's all gone! ;(

Not all of it. Mine is Well, what was it worth for anyway.

As for the craft of the post, not very good looking, but it sure packs a punch. Good job!

This thing is a beast, and YAY the forums are back!

EDIT: My reputation! NO! It's all gone! ;(

Thanks, and I'm in the same boat. Lost almost all of my reputations.
I Like the look of everything but it has To Many Visible Air intakes!

I Like the look of everything but it has To Many Visible Air intakes!

Yeah, the intake:engine ratio is a very normal 3:1, but with so many intakes not attached to the engines it looks like much more. I want to make a new version with more hidden intakes, better re-entry and better take-off.

Ahhh, butt ugly like any cargo plane worth its salt. I wanted to design a superheavy tanker SSTO, but then I actually started playing around with aircraft and settled for just getting a few wings and an engine into orbit.
For the complexity and all the parts it actually looks cool.

Ahhh, butt ugly like any cargo plane worth its salt. I wanted to design a superheavy tanker SSTO, but then I actually started playing around with aircraft and settled for just getting a few wings and an engine into orbit.

Pa1983 had a really great cargo SSTO on here (before the great forum wipe) that was completely enclosed. It looked like a X-33 and could carry a full orange tank to orbit, but IIRC it was a bit intake spammy.

It is butt-ugly, but I want to improve that in the new version.
